title: Exponential and Logarithmic - Rewriting and Solving - Part C

content.question: Part C The function <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>m</mn> </math> is given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>m</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <msup> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <msup> <mn>2</mn> <mi>x</mi> </msup> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>−</mo> <mn>7</mn> <mo>⋅</mo> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <msup> <mn>2</mn> <mi>x</mi> </msup> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>+</mo> <mn>6</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@47B4@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Find all input values in the domain of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>m</mn> </math> that yield an output value of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>0</mn> </math>.

Find all input values in the domain of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>m</mn> </math> that yield an output value of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>0</mn> </math>.

topic.text: 2.13: Exponential and Logarithmic Equations and Inequalities

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Solve equations and inequalities represented analytically, with and without technology.
